name: Ellen D. Zhong
content: Ellen Zhong CS Skip to main content Ellen Zhong Assistant Professor Contact Building 314 Computer Science Envelope zhonge@cs.princeton.edu Phone (609) 258-9075 Diploma Ph.D., Massachusetts Institute of Technology, 2022 Homepage Research Areas Machine Learning Computational Biology Short Bio Ellen Zhong is an Assistant Professor of Computer Science at Princeton University where she leads the E.Z. Lab for Molecular Machine Learning. She is interested in problems at the intersection of AI and biology. Her research focuses on developing methods for image analysis and 3D reconstruction that enable new discoveries in protein structure, dynamics, and interactions. She obtained her Ph.D. from MIT in 2022, where she developed deep learning methods for 3D reconstruction of dynamic protein structures from cryo-EM images. She interned at DeepMind on the AlphaFold team, and prior to her Ph.D. she worked at D. E. Shaw Research on molecular dynamics algorithms for drug discovery.For more information about her research and group, please visit her group website: https://ezlab.princeton.edu Other Affiliations MolBio PBI Related News November 5, 2025 Tri Dao and Ellen Zhong named AI2050 Fellows by Schmidt Sciences Tri Dao and Ellen Zhong, assistant professors of computer science, have been named AI2050 Early Career Fellows by Schmidt Sciences. October 8, 2025 Ellen Zhong wins NIH New Innovator Award Computational biologist Ellen Zhong has received a New Innovator Award from the National Institutes of Health. May 16, 2025 Ben Eysenbach and Ellen Zhong win junior faculty awards The School of Engineering and Applied Science has honored Ben Eysenbach and Ellen Zhong with junior faculty awards for excellence in research and teaching. October 10, 2024 Two Presidential Postdoctoral Research Fellows join the department Two Princeton Presidential Postdoctoral Research Fellows join the computer science department. September 18, 2024 Initiative aims to make Princeton a leader in AI accelerated engineering Princeton University has launched AI for Accelerating Invention, an initiative to achieve faster breakthroughs across engineering disciplines. March 28, 2024 Faculty commended for outstanding teaching Computer science recognized for their outstanding teaching during the fall 2023 semester.
